p: Chaga mushroom ( I. obliquus) has been used as a traditional medicinal mushroom in Russia, Poland, and the Baltic States for 500 years, predominantly for treatment of pulmonary tuberculosis, liver disease, gastritis, gastrointestinal cancer, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes ( Cui et al., 2005). Chaga contains a variety of polyphenols and flavonoids, thus acts as a powerful antioxidant ( Kim et al., 2008; Liang et al., 2009). In addition, similar to other mushrooms, Chaga contains various polysaccharides and is rich in Î²-glucan.
